segments.text: I notice the woman’s foot is already in the water, but she doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she’s just polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool, and it looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the girl’s hand reaching up, waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and she’s still just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window makes everything look so peaceful, but it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything seems on the surface.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies that they don’t see the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR
